summary: This is an email from a federal prosecutor to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team regarding the production of additional discovery materials in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell. It includes cover letters and indices for witness materials and exhibits, to be delivered via electronic and physical means.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding discovery production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding discovery production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding discovery production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330). The email mentions sending a hard drive to the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) for her.

events.title: Discovery Production in US v. Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office notifies Maxwell's defense team that an additional discovery production, including supplemental witness materials and exhibits, is ready for delivery.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is formal discovery correspondence in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The prosecution is providing supplemental materials related to testifying witnesses, non-testifying witnesses, and government exhibits.
The production is being delivered both electronically (USAfx) and physically via a hard drive sent to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email identifies Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca as members of Maxwell's defense team.
